issue.title: Why the plugin upload forces a restart of the instance ?
issue.body:
gReview is supposed to be a v2 plugin, meaning we should be able to to have hot installations/uninstallations/upgrades without a restart. But each time I either make a fresh install or try to upgrade I can't get it until I restart. I keep getting “This add-on will be installed when the application is restarted” or “This add-on will be updated when you restart the application”.

Do you have any idea what in this plugin might cause this ?

issue.title: Upgrade Apache Commons Collections to v3.2.2
issue.body:
Version 3.2.1 has a CVSS 10.0 vulnerability. That's the worst kind of
vulnerability that exists. By merely existing on the classpath, this
library causes the Java serialization parser for the entire JVM process
to go from being a state machine to a turing machine. A turing machine
with an exec() function!

https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2015-8103
https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-collections/security-reports.html
http://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/

issue.title: Problem with config folder creation
issue.body:
Hi Team

Looks like that there is a problem with config directory if Bamboo is using certain versions of Java and especially latest one.

The code in https://github.com/onepremise/gReview/blob/master/src/main/java/com/houghtonassociates/bamboo/plugins/GerritRepositoryAdapter.java#L477 is trying to create the config directory and set the permissions on it.

It is failing to do so as setExecutable, setReadable, setReadOnly, setWritable does not do the right stuff and folder gets the "drw-r--r--" permission instead of "drwx------".

This could be potentially related to:

Legacy Java functionality:
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/io/legacy.html

Error in current code ordering ...
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14052388/setting-file-permissions-returns-false-always

Could you please check it?

Regards,
Areg

issue.title: Unable to install the plugin in Bamboo 5.10.0
issue.body:
Hi Team,  

We have tried installing the plugin in Bamboo 5.10.0. However, we are getting the below error:  

This add-on could not be loaded. It has one or more errors that prevent it from being enabled. Refer to the logs for more information.  

We could not find any specific error in the logs.  We have tried both 1.4.6.7, 1.4.6.5 versions.

issue.title: gReview probelm - bamboo is checking out master branch
issue.body:
Hey !

I have a problem with bamboo gReview plugin. 

I have created new plan and connected it to gerrit reporistory. 
Bamboo is pulling repository for changes.

I have develop branch and each commit lands there. 
After commit the special user is invoking bamboo build plan for gerrit verification and this case works fine. 

But another problem is that when reviewer merges that commit to develop branch, the bamboo plan is being invoked and apart from building develop branch it builds master branch. 

The same situation exists when I run plan from bamboo manually. It takes revision from master and it tries to build it apart from building develop branch. How to tell bamboo that develop branch should be pulled for changes ?

Why this second build is triggered on master ? Do you have any idea  ? I thought it can be some configuration with repository, but not sure how to work it out.

issue.title: Gitweb links broken
issue.body: In the Build Summary tab, the gitweb links to the commits are broken - it is generating links like "https://gerrit1:8443/gitweb/?p=devrepo/repo.git;a=commit; h=7e384362c24d121e0c9ba20e8b48cc6006e8c13b" (notice the extraneous slash between gitweb and ?p). I've verified that I didn't do something silly like add a trailing slash in the gitweb URL in the plan config. Is anyone else seeing this issue? This is with Bamboo 5.7.2 and gReview 1.4.4.1

issue.title: [greview gerrit plugin]How to restrict bamboo to poll the changes only on a particular branch
issue.body:
Hi,

We are using greview gerrit plugin to do make our continous builds,process is as soon as some developer submits a change to our gerrit datbase,bamboo greview plugin will see it ,the problem we are facing is ,the plugin is polling changes for a specific project across all branches,we want to restrict the poll to only a specific branch.

I do see a an option for "create branch" in the planconfiguration under branches tab,we filled-in the details for displayname(as name of branch) and branch description under"branch details" and enabled the branch but it doesnt seem to take affect.Anything we are missing or the plugin doesnt have the support.

Plugin we are using currently is from git clone git://github.com/onepremise/gReview.git 

Please let me know quickly if any details are needed

Thanks

issue.title: gReview probelm - bamboo is checking out master branch
issue.body:
Hey !

I have a problem with bamboo gReview plugin. 

I have created new plan and connected it to gerrit reporistory. 
Bamboo is pulling repository for changes.

I have develop branch and each commit lands there. 
After commit the special user is invoking bamboo build plan for gerrit verification and this case works fine. 

But another problem is that when reviewer merges that commit to develop branch, the bamboo plan is being invoked and apart from building develop branch it builds master branch. 

The same situation exists when I run plan from bamboo manually. It takes revision from master and it tries to build it apart from building develop branch. How to tell bamboo that develop branch should be pulled for changes ?

Why this second build is triggered on master ? Do you have any idea  ? I thought it can be some configuration with repository, but not sure how to work it out.

issue.title: Bamboo 4.3 support
issue.body:
I compiled gReview with new Atlassian git plugin, because version 1.9.9 is not compatible with bamboo 4.3 new API. Unfortunately builds fail after 10 seconds - only on the remote agents.
It seems to me that we would enter file version of the plugin as `${bamboo,version}` rather than a specific version, e.g. 1.9.9 in pom.xml file. This will significantly facilitate subsequent updates.

```
     Bamboo version: 4.3.3
     gReview version: 1.2.9
     Bamboo GIT plugin: bamboo-git-plugin-2.4(default) and bamboo-git-plugin-2.5.2 
     OS: Ubuntu 12.04
     System GIT version: 1.7.9.5
```

In version 4.2 in the same configuration worked perfectly.

Bamboo error:

```
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Checkout to revision "COMMIT_HASH_ID" has failed.command /usr/bin/git log -1 --format=%d --decorate=full "COMMIT_HASH_ID" failed with code 128. Working directory was ["BAMBOO_AGENT_HOME_AND_BUILD-DIR_PATH"/src]., stderr:
fatal: bad object "COMMIT_HASH_ID"

    at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.rerun(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:132)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.runTask(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:88)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.retry(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:191)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.retry(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:176)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs.task.VcsCheckoutTask.execute(VcsCheckoutTask.java:109)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskExecutorImpl.executeTasks(TaskExecutorImpl.java:181)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskExecutorImpl.executePreparationTasks(TaskExecutorImpl.java:69)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.tasks.PrepareBuildTask.call(PrepareBuildTask.java:69)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent.build(DefaultBuildAgent.java:206)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl.waitAndPerformBuild(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:103)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent$1.run(DefaultBuildAgent.java:111)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.concurrent.NamedThreadFactory$2.run(NamedThreadFactory.java:52)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722)
Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Checkout to revision "COMMIT_HASH_ID" has failed.command /usr/bin/git log -1 --format=%d --decorate=full "COMMIT_HASH_ID" failed with code 128. Working directory was ["BAMBOO_AGENT_HOME_AND_BUILD-DIR_PATH"/src]., stderr:
fatal: bad object "COMMIT_HASH_ID"

    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.NativeGitOperationHelper.checkout(NativeGitOperationHelper.java:384)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitRepository.retrieveSourceCode(GitRepository.java:342)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitRepository.retrieveSourceCode(GitRepository.java:272)
    at com.houghtonassociates.bamboo.plugins.GerritRepositoryAdapter.retrieveSourceCode(GerritRepositoryAdapter.java:736)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs.task.VcsCheckoutTask.fillWorkingDirFromVcs(VcsCheckoutTask.java:180)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs.task.VcsCheckoutTask.access$100(VcsCheckoutTask.java:46)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs.task.VcsCheckoutTask$1.call(VcsCheckoutTask.java:114)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs.task.VcsCheckoutTask$1.call(VcsCheckoutTask.java:110)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.rerun(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:108)
    ... 12 more
Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandException: command /usr/bin/git log -1 --format=%d --decorate=full "COMMIT_HASH_ID" failed with code 128. Working directory was ["BAMBOO_AGENT_HOME_AND_BUILD-DIR_PATH"/src]., stderr:
fatal: bad object "COMMIT_HASH_ID"

    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandProcessor.runCommand(GitCommandProcessor.java:401)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandProcessor.getPossibleBranchNameForCheckout(GitCommandProcessor.java:292)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandProcessor.runCheckoutCommand(GitCommandProcessor.java:252)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.NativeGitOperationHelper.checkout(NativeGitOperationHelper.java:375)
    ... 20 more
Caused by: com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 128
    at com.atlassian.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.complete(PluggableProcessHandler.java:83)
    at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcess.finish(ExternalProcess.java:376)
    at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcess.execute(ExternalProcess.java:419)
    at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandProcessor.runCommand(GitCommandProcessor.java:393)
    ... 23 more
```

In the logs you will find that when you checkout the code, we have two different messages:
- the local agent: Fetching 'refs/heads/master'
- the remote agent: Fetching 'refs/heads/*'

It does not work even when you enter the `master` branch in the configuration.
